titleStmt.title: Letter, T. R. Cornick in Knoxville, Tenn., to J.G.M. Ramsey in Charlotte, N.C.1871 Apr. 15

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

bibl.title: Letter, T.R. Cornick in Knoxville, Tenn., to J.G.M. Ramsey in Charlotte, N.C. 1871 Apr. 15
bibl.note: T.R. Cornick wrote to J.G.M. Ramsey from Knoxville on April 15, 1871. Ramsey was in Charlotte, N.C. Cornick informed Ramsey that Chancery Court closed with none of his Bank of E. Tenn. cases being heard, but with the possibility they could be taken up in special session during the next month.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

keywords.term: Bankers -- Legal status, laws, etc. -- Tennessee -- Knoxville.
Ramsey, J. G. M. (James Gettys McGready), 1797-1884 -- Correspondence.

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Dear Sir, Our spring term of Chancery Court closed last Saturday. none of your Bank of E. Tenn. cases were taken up. A special term will commence on 5th Monday of next month, when it is probable they will be taken up. I will keep you advised.
